author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Sujato Bhikkhu

segments.pli: “Rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anattā, vedanā anattā, saññā anattā, saṅkhārā anattā, viññāṇaṃ anattā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are not-self.

segments.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako rūpasmimpi nibbindati, vedanāyapi nibbindati, saññāyapi nibbindati, saṅkhāresupi nibbindati, viññāṇasmimpi nibbindati.
segments.en: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple becomes disillusioned with form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.

segments.pli: Nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati. Vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Being disillusioned they become dispassionate. Being dispassionate they’re freed. When freed, they know ‘it is freed’.

segments.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānātī”ti.
segments.en: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”

suttaplex.blurb: Because the aggregates are not-self, a noble disciple becomes disillusioned with them.
